security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing no executable code, scripts, or network capabilities. Provides guidance for configuring Daem0n-MCP memory management system. No malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Managing project context across sessions and multiple repositories is challenging. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for initializing and consolidating Daem0n-MCP memory management across project structures.
actual_capabilities: Initialize Daem0n-MCP in single repository projects
Set up shared memory across multiple related repositories
Link related repos for cross-project context awareness
Consolidate memory databases from child repositories
Configure automatic memory capture via Claude hooks
Tune search parameters for hybrid vector and TF-IDF matching
limitations: This skill provides guidance only; Daem0n-MCP must be installed separately
Does not execute commands or modify files directly
Does not provide Daem0n-MCP tooling or CLI access
Requires Claude Code hooks configuration for automatic features

best_practices: Use a parent directory for shared memory when working with multiple related repositories
Link child repositories before consolidating databases to define what memories to merge
Verify consolidation by checking combined memory counts with get_briefing()
anti_patterns: Initializing separate Daem0n instances in each repo without linking them
Deleting .daem0nmcp without backing up first when migrating configurations
Skipping the link_projects() step before consolidate_linked_databases()

faq.question: Is Daem0n-MCP compatible with Claude Code on all operating systems?
faq.answer: Yes, Daem0n-MCP works on Linux, macOS, and Windows as long as Python 3.9+ is installed.

faq.question: What are the resource limits for memory storage?
faq.answer: Memory limits depend on your storage. The tool uses SQLite with incremental indexing for efficiency.

faq.question: How does Daem0n-MCP integrate with existing Claude Code workflows?
faq.answer: It integrates via MCP protocol. Use hooks for automatic capture and CLI commands for manual recall.

faq.question: Does this skill store or transmit any user data?
faq.answer: No. This skill is purely documentation. Data storage is handled by Daem0n-MCP locally on your machine.

faq.question: Why is my consolidated memory count lower than expected?
faq.answer: Ensure you called link_projects() before consolidate_linked_databases(). Check that child repos have .daem0nmcp data.

faq.question: How does this compare to Claude's built-in context memory?
faq.answer: Daem0n-MCP provides persistent cross-session memory, multi-repo awareness, and automatic decision capture beyond standard context.
